text: This letter is from Paul. I am a missionary for Jesus Christ. God wanted me to work for Him. This letter is to those who belong to Christ in the city of Ephesus and to you who are faithful followers of Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: May you have loving-favor and peace from God our Father and from our Lord Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let us honor and thank the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ. He has already given us a taste of what heaven is like.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even before the world was made, God chose us for Himself because of His love. He planned that we should be holy and without blame as He sees us.
speaker: Narrator

text: God already planned to have us as His own children. This was done by Jesus Christ. In His plan God wanted this done.
speaker: Narrator

text: We thank God for His loving-favor to us. He gave this loving-favor to us through His much-loved Son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because of the blood of Christ, we are bought and made free from the punishment of sin. And because of His blood, our sins are forgiven. His loving-favor to us is so rich.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was so willing to give all of this to us. He did this with wisdom and understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text: God told us the secret of what He wanted to do. It is this: In loving thought He planned long ago to send Christ into the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: The plan was for Christ to gather us all together at the right time. If we are in heaven or still on earth, He will bring us together and will be head over all.
speaker: Narrator

text: We were already chosen to be God’s own children by Christ. This was done just like the plan He had.
speaker: Narrator

text: We who were the first to put our trust in Christ should thank Him for His greatness.
speaker: Narrator

text: The truth is the Good News. When you heard the truth, you put your trust in Christ. Then God marked you by giving you His Holy Spirit as a promise.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Holy Spirit was given to us as a promise that we will receive everything God has for us. God’s Spirit will be with us until God finishes His work of making us complete. God does this to show His shining-greatness.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have heard of your faith in the Lord Jesus and your love for all Christians.
speaker: Narrator

text: Since then, I always give thanks for you and pray for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: I pray that the great God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ may give you the wisdom of His Spirit. Then you will be able to understand the secrets about Him as you know Him better.
speaker: Narrator

text: I pray that your hearts will be able to understand. I pray that you will know about the hope given by God’s call. I pray that you will see how great the things are that He has promised to those who belong to Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: I pray that you will know how great His power is for those who have put their trust in Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is the same power that raised Christ from the dead. This same power put Christ at God’s right side in heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: This place was given to Christ. It is much greater than any king or leader can have. No one else can have this place of honor and power. No one in this world or in the world to come can have such honor and power.
speaker: Narrator

text: God has put all things under Christ’s power and has made Him to be the head leader over all things of the church.
speaker: Narrator

text: The church is the body of Christ. It is filled by Him Who fills all things everywhere with Himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: At one time you were dead because of your sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: You followed the sinful ways of the world and obeyed the leader of the power of darkness. He is the devil who is now working in the people who do not obey God.
speaker: Narrator

text: At one time all of us lived to please our old selves. We gave in to what our bodies and minds wanted. We were sinful from birth like all other people and would suffer from the anger of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God had so much loving-kindness. He loved us with such a great love.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even when we were dead because of our sins, He made us alive by what Christ did for us. You have been saved from the punishment of sin by His loving-favor.
speaker: Narrator

text: God raised us up from death when He raised up Christ Jesus. He has given us a place with Christ in the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: He did this to show us through all the time to come the great riches of His loving-favor. He has shown us His kindness through Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: For by His loving-favor you have been saved from the punishment of sin through faith. It is not by anything you have done. It is a gift of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is not given to you because you worked for it. If you could work for it, you would be proud.
speaker: Narrator

text: We are His work. He has made us to belong to Christ Jesus so we can work for Him. He planned that we should do this.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not forget that at one time you did not know God. The Jews, who had gone through the religious act of becoming a Jew by man’s hands, said you were people who do not know God.
speaker: Narrator

text: You were living without Christ then. The Jewish people who belonged to God had nothing to do with you. The promises He gave to them were not for you. You had nothing in this world to hope for. You were without God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But now you belong to Christ Jesus. At one time you were far away from God. Now you have been brought close to Him. Christ did this for you when He gave His blood on the cross.
speaker: Narrator

text: We have peace because of Christ. He has made the Jews and those who are not Jews one people. He broke down the wall that divided them.
speaker: Narrator

text: He stopped the fighting between them by His death on the cross. He put an end to the Law. Then He made of the two people one new kind of people like Himself. In this way, He made peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: He brought both groups together to God. Christ finished the fighting between them by His death on the cross.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Christ came and preached the Good News of peace to you who were far away from God. And He preached it to us who were near God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now all of us can go to the Father through Christ by way of the one Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: From now on you are not strangers and people who are not citizens. You are citizens together with those who belong to God. You belong in God’s family.
speaker: Narrator

text: This family is built on the teachings of the missionaries and the early preachers. Jesus Christ Himself is the cornerstone, which is the most important part of the building.
speaker: Narrator

text: Christ keeps this building together and it is growing into a holy building for the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are also being put together as a part of this building because God lives in you by His Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: I, Paul, am in prison because I am a missionary for Jesus Christ to you who are not Jews.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am sure you have heard that God trusted me with His loving-favor.
speaker: Narrator

text: I wrote a little about this to you before. In a special way, God showed me His secret plan.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you read this, you will understand how I know about the things that are not easy to understand about Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: Long ago men did not know these things. But now they have been shown to His missionaries and to the early preachers by the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let me tell you that the Good News is for the people who are not Jews also. They are able to have life that lasts forever. They are to be a part of His church and family, together with the Jews. And together they are to receive all that God has promised through Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: God asked me to preach this Good News. He gave me the gift of His loving-favor. He gave me His power to preach it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of all those who belong to Christ, I am the least important. But this loving-favor was given to me to preach to the people who are not Jews. I was to tell them of the great riches in Christ which do not come to an end.
speaker: Narrator

text: I was to make all men understand the meaning of this secret. God kept this secret to Himself from the beginning of the world. And He is the One Who made all things.
speaker: Narrator

text: This was done so the great wisdom of God might be shown now to the leaders and powers in the heavenly places. It is being done through the church.
speaker: Narrator

text: This was the plan God had for all time. He did this through Christ Jesus our Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: We can come to God without fear because we have put our trust in Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I ask you not to lose heart because of my suffering for you. It is to help you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this reason, I bow my knees and pray to the Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is from Him that every family in heaven and on earth has its name.
speaker: Narrator

text: I pray that because of the riches of His shining-greatness, He will make you strong with power in your hearts through the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: I pray that Christ may live in your hearts by faith. I pray that you will be filled with love.
speaker: Narrator

text: I pray that you will be able to understand how wide and how long and how high and how deep His love is.
speaker: Narrator

text: I pray that you will know the love of Christ. His love goes beyond anything we can understand. I pray that you will be filled with God Himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: God is able to do much more than we ask or think through His power working in us.
speaker: Narrator

text: May we see His shining-greatness in the church. May all people in all time honor Christ Jesus. Let it be so.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am being held in prison because of working for the Lord. I ask you from my heart to live and work the way the Lord expected you to live and work.
speaker: Narrator

text: Live and work without pride. Be gentle and kind. Do not be hard on others. Let love keep you from doing that.
speaker: Narrator

text: Work hard to live together as one by the help of the Holy Spirit. Then there will be peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is one body and one Spirit. There is one hope in which you were called.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is one Lord and one faith and one baptism.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is one God. He is the Father of us all. He is over us all. He is the One working through us all. He is the One living in us all.
speaker: Narrator

text: Loving-favor has been given to each one of us. We can see how great it is by the gift of Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Holy Writings say, “When Christ went up to heaven, He took those who were held with Him. He gave gifts to men.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When they say, “He went up,” what does it mean but that He had first gone down to the deep parts of the earth?
speaker: Narrator

text: Christ Who went down into the deep also went up far above the heavens. He did this to fill all the world with Himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: Christ gave gifts to men. He gave to some the gift to be missionaries, some to be preachers, others to be preachers who go from town to town. He gave others the gift to be church leaders and teachers.
speaker: Narrator

text: These gifts help His people work well for Him. And then the church which is the body of Christ will be made strong.
speaker: Narrator

text: All of us are to be as one in the faith and in knowing the Son of God. We are to be full-grown Christians standing as high and complete as Christ is Himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then we will not be as children any longer. Children are like boats thrown up and down on big waves. They are blown with the wind. False teaching is like the wind. False teachers try everything possible to make people believe a lie,
speaker: Narrator

text: but we are to hold to the truth with love in our hearts. We are to grow up and be more like Christ. He is the leader of the church.
speaker: Narrator

text: Christ has put each part of the church in its right place. Each part helps other parts. This is what is needed to keep the whole body together. In this way, the whole body grows strong in love.
speaker: Narrator

text: I tell you this in the name of the Lord: You must not live any longer like the people of the world who do not know God. Their thoughts are foolish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their minds are in darkness. They are strangers to the life of God. This is because they have closed their minds to Him and have turned their hearts away from Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: They do not care anymore about what is right or wrong. They have turned themselves over to the sinful ways of the world and are always wanting to do every kind of sinful act they can think of.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you did not learn anything like this from Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you have heard of Him and have learned from Him,
speaker: Narrator

text: put away the old person you used to be. Have nothing to do with your old sinful life. It was sinful because of being fooled into following bad desires.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let your minds and hearts be made new.
speaker: Narrator

text: You must become a new person and be God-like. Then you will be made right with God and have a true holy life.
speaker: Narrator

text: So stop lying to each other. Tell the truth to your neighbor. We all belong to the same body.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you are angry, do not let it become sin. Get over your anger before the day is finished.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not let the devil start working in your life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Anyone who steals must stop it! He must work with his hands so he will have what he needs and can give to those who need help.
speaker: Narrator

text: Watch your talk! No bad words should be coming from your mouth. Say what is good. Your words should help others grow as Christians.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not make God’s Holy Spirit have sorrow for the way you live. The Holy Spirit has put a mark on you for the day you will be set free.
speaker: Narrator

text: Put out of your life all these things: bad feelings about other people, anger, temper, loud talk, bad talk which hurts other people, and bad feelings which hurt other people.
speaker: Narrator

text: You must be kind to each other. Think of the other person. Forgive other people just as God forgave you because of Christ’s death on the cross.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do as God would do. Much-loved children want to do as their fathers do.
speaker: Narrator

text: Live with love as Christ loved you. He gave Himself for us, a gift on the altar to God which was as a sweet smell to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not let sex sins or anything sinful be even talked about among those who belong to Christ. Do not always want everything.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not be guilty of telling bad stories and of foolish talk. These things are not for you to do. Instead, you are to give thanks for what God has done for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be sure of this! No person who does sex sins or who is not pure will have any part in the holy nation of Christ and of God. The same is true for the person who always wants what other people have. This becomes a god to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not let anyone lead you in the wrong way with foolish talk. The anger of God comes on such people because they choose to not obey Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have nothing to do with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: At one time you lived in darkness. Now you are living in the light that comes from the Lord. Live as children who have the light of the Lord in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: This light gives us truth. It makes us right with God and makes us good.
speaker: Narrator

text: Learn how to please the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have nothing to do with the bad things done in darkness. Instead, show that these things are wrong.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is a shame even to talk about these things done in secret.
speaker: Narrator

text: All things can be seen when they are in the light. Everything that can be seen is in the light.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Holy Writings say, “Wake up, you who are sleeping. Rise from the dead and Christ will give you light.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So be careful how you live. Live as men who are wise and not foolish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make the best use of your time. These are sinful days.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not be foolish. Understand what the Lord wants you to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not get drunk with wine. That leads to wild living. Instead, be filled with the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Tell of your joy to each other by singing the Songs of David and church songs. Sing in your heart to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Always give thanks for all things to God the Father in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be willing to help and care for each other because of Christ. By doing this, you honor Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wives, obey your own husbands. In doing this, you obey the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: For a husband is the head of his wife as Christ is the head of the church. It is His body (the church) that He saves.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the church is to obey Christ, wives are to obey their own husbands in everything.
speaker: Narrator

text: Husbands, love your wives. You must love them as Christ loved the church. He gave His life for it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Christ did this so He could set the church apart for Himself. He made it clean by the washing of water with the Word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Christ did this so the church might stand before Him in shining-greatness. There is to be no sin of any kind in it. It is to be holy and without blame.
speaker: Narrator

text: So men should love their wives as they love their own bodies. He who loves his wife loves himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: No man hates himself. He takes care of his own body. That is the way Christ does. He cares for His body which is the church.
speaker: Narrator

text: We are all a part of His body, the church.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this reason, a man must leave his father and mother when he gets married and be joined to his wife. The two become one.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is hard to understand, but it shows that the church is the body of Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: So every man must love his wife as he loves himself. Every wife must respect her husband.
speaker: Narrator

text: Children, as Christians, obey your parents. This is the right thing to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: Respect your father and mother. This is the first Law given that had a promise.
speaker: Narrator

text: The promise is this: If you respect your father and mother, you will live a long time and your life will be full of many good things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fathers, do not be too hard on your children so they will become angry. Teach them in their growing years with Christian teaching.
speaker: Narrator

text: You servants who are owned by someone must obey your owners. Work for them as hard as you can. Work for them the same as if you were working for Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not work hard only when your owner sees you. You would be doing this just to please men. Work as you would work for Christ. Do what God wants you to do with all your heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be happy as you work. Do your work as for the Lord, not for men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember this, whatever good thing you do, the Lord will pay you for it. It is the same to the Lord if you are a servant owned by someone or if you work for pay.
speaker: Narrator

text: Owners, do the right thing for those who work for you. Stop saying that you are going to be hard on them. Remember that your Owner and their Owner is in heaven. God does not respect one person more than another.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the last thing I want to say: Be strong with the Lord’s strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: Put on the things God gives you to fight with. Then you will not fall into the traps of the devil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our fight is not with people. It is against the leaders and the powers and the spirits of darkness in this world. It is against the demon world that works in the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because of this, put on all the things God gives you to fight with. Then you will be able to stand in that sinful day. When it is all over, you will still be standing.
speaker: Narrator

text: So stand up and do not be moved. Wear a belt of truth around your body. Wear a piece of iron over your chest which is being right with God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wear shoes on your feet which are the Good News of peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: Most important of all, you need a covering of faith in front of you. This is to put out the fire-arrows of the devil.
speaker: Narrator

text: The covering for your head is that you have been saved from the punishment of sin. Take the sword of the Spirit which is the Word of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: You must pray at all times as the Holy Spirit leads you to pray. Pray for the things that are needed. You must watch and keep on praying. Remember to pray for all Christians.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pray for me also. Pray that I might open my mouth without fear. Pray that I will use the right words to preach that which is hard to understand in the Good News.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the reason I was sent out. But now I am in chains for preaching the Good News. I want to keep on speaking for Christ without fear the way I should.
speaker: Narrator

text: Tychicus will tell you how I am getting along. He is a much-loved brother and a faithful preacher.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have sent him to you because I want him to tell you about us. He will comfort you.
speaker: Narrator

text: May all the Christian brothers have peace and love with faith from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: May God give loving-favor to all who love our Lord Jesus Christ with a love that never gets weak.
speaker: Narrator
